Thanks for the feedback.

 

My private method fails (during test execution=
) because it interacts with Torque (OR mapping tool) to talk to the databas=
e.  Because this method is private, I can=E2=80=99t override it in a base c=
lass, and I=E2=80=99m a bit at a loss for how to avoid its Torque interacti=
on.  I=E2=80=99m feeling that there must be an injection technique that I c=
an use to get a mock object into that method to circumvent the Torque inter=
action.

 

Any suggestions?

 

-Mitch

 

FWIW, I agree with Elliotte abo=
ut making the private method public/protected.

Re: [junit] Private method throws an exception

 

mitchellch60 wrote:
> My=
 method under test calls a private method in the same class.  The 
> privat=
e method throws an exception preventing me for completing my 
> unit test.
=
> 

The test is failing. That means your code is broken (or just maybe the =

test is broken instead). Either way, fix the breakage, wherever it lies. 
=
Some of the other suggestions you've gotten here are actively harmful 
and =
won't solve your problem (Making the private method public? Bleah.)
